Title: Need a trimmed-down org.eclipse.help
description: build I20030710 As part of the refactoring for the Rich Client Platform (bug 36967) we would like to have a pared-down org.eclipse.help. We want to support the following scenarios: 1. Application wants Help support, provided by the current Help UI (the current situation). 2. Application does not need Help support at all. 3. Application wants to provide its own Help UI. For all of these, it's important for the application footprint to be as small as possible. Clients want to be able to make their apps available for download. The application should not have to ship with plugins that are never used, and the plugins that ship should not have large portions of unused code. The current org.eclipse.help plugin has a disk footprint of 267K (actually 528K if you take into account the 32K chunk size of FAT32 partitions), and also has dependencies on org.apache.lucene (197K) and org.eclipse.help.appserver (25K). From the Workbench's point of view, all we need is access to the IHelp API, and this is very simple. The Help UI and everything that goes with it should be added on as an optional separate plug-in. org.eclipse.help should have just the interfaces for IHelp, IContext, IHelpResource etc. It should have a simple implementation of IHelp which starts the registered help UI (if any) and delegates to it. It should not include anything else, or require any other plugins. This was the original design of Help, but some assumptions about the web-based UI seem to have leaked down to org.eclipse.help.

Title: Comparing two remote versions can result in many connections
description:
The removal of Session.run() means that comparing two remote versions of a
project can result in many connections (and could look like a DOS attack to the
server). We can probably get away without fixing this for M3 as the operation is
not commonly used but we need to fix this for M4. The best approach is probably
to use the cvs diff command.

description:

IStartup interface.  It should allow a class= attribute like other extension 
points.  Without this, startup extensions cannot be added by fragments.

Title: [Live Sync View] handle remote revision # smaller than local
description:
There are cases when Eclipse crashes when the local revision # (stored in the
CVs/Entries) file is greater than that stored in the remote sync tree used by
the CVS subscriber for remembering remote revision numbers.

This case should be handled (e.g. lower remote revision number) by forgetting
about the remote and waiting for the next refresh with remote to re-initialize
the remote state.

Title: StyledText - Scrollwheel event interferes with last caret placement
description:
Styled text remembers the last horizontal offset of the caret in a line.  If 
you are at the end of a really long line, and you press DOWN to a short line, 
then UP, the caret's placement is recalled and it is at the end of the line 
again.

But, if you press DOWN to a short line, then use the scrollwheel, which does 
NOT move the caret, then press UP, the caret's location is not recalled.

Title: [CVS UI] Orphaned CVS folders remain until auto-build
description:
With the switch to background auto-build, the delta listener which cleans up 
orphaned CVS folders will not get executed until the build takes place. This 
can result in improperly decorated resources (no big deal) and improper menu 
enablement. In the latter case, it is probably best to handle this if an 
action is run instead of in the enablement code (since enablement must be 
fast). We can add a pre-check to the actions that ensures that the selected 
resources are managed all the way up the folder chain to the project.

Title: [KeyBindings] Entering key sequence appends to previous by default
description:
build I20030917 + latest from head for UI

- In Keys pref page, select a command with an existing binding, e.g. File > 
Close.
- Select one of the assignments, e.g. Ctrl+F4.  It fills in the key sequence 
field.
- Give focus to the key sequence field, either by tabbing or by clicking with 
the mouse.
- Type a new key binding, e.g. Ctrl+W.
- It appends the new key to the old one, rather than replacing it, e.g. 
Ctrl+F4 Ctrl+W.

It is far more common to associate single key sequences to commands than multi 
key sequences.
When the key sequence field is given focus, it should assume that any key 
entered is to replace the old binding, not to be appended to it.
This should be indicated by automatically selecting the whole existing key 
binding (e.g. as is done in the Address field of a web browser).
Only if the user enters two keys (or key combinations) after the field is 
given focus should it accept a multi key sequence.

Title: Improve launch tab interface notification
description:
Currently, a launch tab is asked to apply its changes (i.e. its current state, 
via #applyChanges) to a launch configuration when the tab is exited. When a tab 
is entered, the tab's "initializeFrom" method is called, such that the tab 
displays for the launch configuration. This allows for inter-tab communication.

The drawbacks with this interface:
* Innefficient - invoking performApply and initializeFrom can be costly for 
tabs that do not rely on inter-tab communication
* Insufficient - a tab cannot tell the difference between "initializing" itself 
for a newly displayed config (or when revert is pressed), and when it is simply 
entered (a tab may want to do this for efficiency reasons - i.e. only perform 
expensive operations once, when a new tab is displayed).

For this reason, we propose that two new methods be added to 
ILaunchConfigurationTab - #tabEntered() and #tabExited(). The methods will be 
called as tabs are exited and entered. As well, #performApply() will only be 
called (by the framework) when a configuration is saved, and #initializeFrom() 
will only be called when a new config is to be displayed, or REVERT has been 
pressed in the dialog. The two new methods will be implemented in the base 
abstract tab class, to do nothing by default.

Tabs that do not rely on inter-tab communication (i.e. do not rely on 
attributes set in other tabs), should not be effected by this change. They will 
just become more efficient. Tabs that do rely on attributes set on other tabs 
will need to override the "tabEntered()" method to update as required. This 
allows tabs to be selective in their updating.

Title: [Keybindings] Open Type keybinding opens Type Hierarchy in non-java perspectives
description:
I20031008: Basically, when CTRL+SHIRT+T is pressed in a java editor in a 
perspective that doesn't have the java navigate actions enabled the editor 
instead opens the in-place type hierarchy. Before, it would simply not run 
anything because the action wasn't enabled (e.g. isn't visible under Navigate 
menu). Now instead, it open the in-place type hierarchy which is bound to 
CTRL+T. This could be a problem with the keybinding service, maybe you could 
confirm:

To reproduce:

1. Start with a clean workspace
2. Create a java project and a class, don't change to the java perspective.
3. Open the new java file in an editor and press Ctrl+Shirt+T.

Title: Exception when trying to start RuntimeWorkbench while workspace is building

files with changes in that branch. My workspace contains HEAD.

but that seems to be a different problem.

---------

Title: release tool: workspace out of sync with repository
description:

In the latest case, the workspace was out of sync with the repository....when
browsing versions in the CVS Repositories view the version existed but when
looking at the repository through viewcvs (or from another workspace), the
version was not created.

- the "don't have write permissions" error message is appropriately conveyed to
the user
- the version information is not incorrectly cached in the workspace

This could be coordinated with the Platform/Team team.

Title: FileLink needs to resolve an editorId
description:
our FileLink implementation accepts a null value for the editorId. With the 
changes in IWorkbenchPage, null is no longer an acceptable value for the 
editorId when opening an editor.

if the FileLink is passed a null editorId we should look up the default editor 
for the editor input.
